definition: to be appointed or elevated to a post
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: Just got our latest scintillating assignment.
sentences.chinese: 刚刚得到我们最新的光荣任务。

sentences.english: Everyone in the office joins me in sending congratulations on your new rank.
sentences.chinese: 全办公室的人和我一起祝贺你荣任新职。

definition: first person to be appointed to a post
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
to take office/to assume a post
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
